title: POA mode with 2 nodes (miner + standard node) doesn't seem to implement miner.gasprice correctly
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `instance=Geth/v1.11.2-stable-73b01f40/linux-amd64/go1.20.1`

OS & Version: Linux docker via `from ethereum/client-go:stable` in docker hub



Infrastructure is composed of two nodes : 
- one miner node that sign blocks with PoA (Clique) 
- one public node that handle RPC http endpoint that we use with metamask. 
 
**Each node are on a different docker and are connected on a same subnetwork**.


important args is `--miner.gasprice "[SEE TABLE BELOW]"`

#### Expected behaviour

Expected behaviour is that the miner which is only connected to the public node (and dont handle RPC http from metamask) don't mine txn with gasfee < miner.gasprice.

This is a table to show you if the miner node decided to mine the txn or not, depending on the gas fee provided and the `--miner.gasprice` configuration:

| --miner.gasprice                                            |  a 1 Gwei gas fee | a 49 Gwei gas fee | a 51 Gwei gas fee | a 510 Gwei gas fee |
|-------------------------------------------------| -------------------| ------------------- | -------------------- | --------------------- |
| `--miner.gasprice "500000000"` **0.5 Gwei**| âœ…| âœ… | âœ…| âœ…|
| `--miner.gasprice "5000000000"` **5 Gwei**| âŒ| âœ… | âœ…| âœ…|
| `--miner.gasprice "50000000000"` **50 Gwei**| âŒ| âŒ | âœ…| âœ…|


#### Actual behaviour

| --miner.gasprice                                            |  a 1 Gwei gas fee | a 49 Gwei gas fee | a 51 Gwei gas fee | a 510 Gwei gas fee |
|-------------------------------------------------| -------------------| ------------------- | -------------------- | --------------------- |
| `--miner.gasprice "500000000"` **0.5 Gwei**| âœ…| âœ… | âœ…| âœ…|
| `--miner.gasprice "5000000000"` **5 Gwei**| âœ…| âœ… | âœ…| âœ…|
| `--miner.gasprice "50000000000"` **50 Gwei**| âŒ| âŒ | âŒ| âŒ|



#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

docker-compose.yaml:
```yaml
  geth_node:
    build: ./geth_node
    restart: always
    ports:
      - "8545:8545"
      - "8546:8546"
    networks:
      - geth-network
  geth_miner:
    build: ./geth_miner
    restart: always
    networks:
      - geth-network
networks:
  geth-network: 
 ```

geth_miner start.sh:
```bash
#!/bin/sh
geth init --datadir /folder/data /folder/genesis.json
geth --datadir /folder/data account import --password /folder/passwd.txt /folder/keyfile
geth --datadir /folder/data --unlock 0xdeadbeef --password=/folder/passwd.txt --miner.gasprice "50000000000" --mine --miner.etherbase=[ETHERBASE] --maxpeers 1 --networkid 31400 --bootnodes "enode://[YOUR_ENODE]@geth_node:65000" --nat extip:$(hostname -i) --netrestrict $(ip -o -f inet addr show | awk '/scope global/ {print $4}')
```

geth_node start.sh:
```bash
#!/bin/sh
geth init --datadir /folder/data /folder/genesis.json
geth --datadir /folder/data --http --http.port 8545 --http.addr 0.0.0.0 --http.corsdomain '*' --http.vhosts "geth_node" --ws --ws.origins '*' --ws.addr 0.0.0.0 --maxpeers 2 --networkid 31400 --port "65000" --nat extip:$(hostname -i) --netrestrict $(ip -o -f inet addr show | awk '/scope global/ {print $4}') --nodekey=/folder/data/geth/nodekey --nodiscover
```

dockerfile to build:
```DOCKERFILE
from ethereum/client-go:stable

RUN mkdir /folder
RUN mkdir /folder/data
COPY ./genesis.json /folder/
COPY ./start.sh /folder/
COPY ./nodekey /folder/data/geth/
ENTRYPOINT /folder/start.sh
```

genesis.json (config part only):
```json
  "config": {
    "chainId": 31400,
    "homesteadBlock": 0,
    "eip150Block": 0,
    "eip155Block": 0,
    "eip158Block": 0,
    "byzantiumBlock": 0,
    "constantinopleBlock": 0,
    "petersburgBlock": 0,
    "istanbulBlock": 0,
    "berlinBlock": 0,
    "londonBlock": 0,
    "clique": {
        "period": 12,
        "epoch": 30000
      }
  }
```

This is a bit strange, if I try it locally, when I set a gas price on the miner and enable mining, I will get this log:

```
$ geth --rinkeby --miner.gasprice "50000" --mine

[...]

INFO [03-08|08:55:03.993] Transaction pool price threshold updated price=50000
```

which is what I would expect.

Could you please share the transactions too that you added?

One more thought. Geth's txpool supports `local` accounts. Meaning accounts that are "special cased" and are allowed to go below pool and miner limits. There are 3 ways to have an account be marked as local:

- Set via a CLI flag `--txpool.locals`
- Receive an RPC tx causing the sender to be assumed local (can work around with `--txpool.nolocals`)
- Miner address

Perhaps the last one is the culprit in your case? If you are sending the transaction from the same address that you are mining the blocks with, the miner will just ignore gas prices for itself and mine them anyway.

Hello, 
>Perhaps the last one is the culprit in your case? If you are sending the transaction from the same address that you are mining the blocks with, the miner will just ignore gas prices for itself and mine them anyway.

I'm sending transaction from different account than the miner account. Plus, the 50 Gwei miner.gasprice would work in any case if so, right ? 

This is some logs from miner and public node:

###  `--miner.gasprice "50000000000"` (50 Gwei) and a  51 Gwei txn sent with metamask

Should mine the txn `0xfe8135da6bb4e5154a0d51df9c64fd55d5dcf2860406e98d77a47fc2adcebc96` but actually dont mine it.

Ok i figured it out the problem:

`--miner.gasprice` refer in fact with **EIP-1559 Gas Fees** on the **Priority Fees** and not the **Max Fee Per Gas**. I think i'm not the only one which have made the confusion. On the private network the **Base fees** are barely 0.5 Gwei and metamask set automatically the **Priority Fees** at 2.5 Gwei. I set on the transaction 51 **Max Fee Per Gas**. Everything works well when you set **Priority Fees** to 51 Gwei as expected 

It would be interesting to add a paragraph on the official doc to explain the behavior ?

Closing that issue :)

The "semantic meaning" of `--miner.gasprice` originally was: "don't include txs unless I earn X eth per gas on them". 
Therefore, with basefeee, we decided that the equivalent was to make it target priority fees, and _not_ the absolute. That is, the miner uses the flag to set a earning-target, and doesn't care about basefee fluctuations.
Indeed, that makes sense. However, I think it would be interesting to clarify this point in the documentation so as not to create confusion :)
